text: Hi All! joining to see how I can incorporate Julia into commercial SaaS product development. I did a DS certificate to get my foot into the industry and having worked a lot with compiled languages such as Swift, Go, C# to name a few left me a bit unsatisfied when using Python as the primary language for DS exploration and modeling. I've just started learning Julia but I hope I can contribute to it in the near future! to start I'll just be trying out the ML basics from python to Julia, if anyone can share good resources that would be awesome!

elements.text: Hi All! joining to see how I can incorporate Julia into commercial SaaS product development. I did a DS certificate to get my foot into the industry and having worked a lot with compiled languages such as Swift, Go, C# to name a few left me a bit unsatisfied when using Python as the primary language for DS exploration and modeling. I've just started learning Julia but I hope I can contribute to it in the near future! to start I'll just be trying out the ML basics from python to Julia, if anyone can share good resources that would be awesome!

text:
<#CC57ZE7EY|mlj> <#CN04R7WKE|sciml-bridged> <#C690QRAA3|machine-learning> are probably good places to start on slack. There are a bunch of packages implementing different pieces, many are centered around the MLJ framework. 

Feel free to ask here or in discourse of you're looking for something in particular that you can't find, or you find too many options and want to know the pros and cons
